title: Do you need to be in USA for successfully doing a tech startup? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, you don't "need to be" in the USA for building a successful startup. Being in the San Francisco Bay Area significantly increases your chances of doing a successful tech startup because of 3 reasons: 1) Ecosystem is very conducive to the building one2) Massive pool of technical talent & startup vets3) Availability of funds But that being said, there is no mandate that you need to be there to succeed. There are tones of startups which fail despite being HQd in SF or relocating to SF. Its unlike like the movies & entertainment business where where you pretty much need to be in Los Angeles area to be discovered or in Mumbai when it comes to Bollywood or TV soaps.
There have been a few successful tech companies outside the US like HCL and Indian consulting companies, but funding is much easier to get if you are from a top US university and live in the bay.
